channel.title: PvP in Varrock
channel.description: I am having trouble adding PvP to Varrock, I've been looking at heaps of tuts and it wont work. If you help me out with this you wont regret it :D

item.title: PvP in Varrock
item.dc:creator: @Pzezima2 Pzezima2
item.description:
@Pzezima2 wrote:

Well feel free to add it on my server

Read full topic

item.title: PvP in Varrock
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Pzezima2, post:5, topic:426788”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=529486.msg3864120#msg3864120 date=1324860581]

Find your “isinwilderness” method and convert it to Varrock coordinates. What source are you using?

Ive done all that, I’m using 317 PI but the way this server is coded is completely different to any other ones i’ve seen.
Very very different.

I don’t understand what you’re having trouble with. Check to make sure that your coordinates are in the right order. Also, make sure that you don’t need to add it anywhere else. Just look for your “wildarea” method more.
[/quote]
Its just, with tuts for example they ask to go into player.java and search for inWild() etc but they’re all in a different file. And most stuff thats usually in the client.java is in its own class file etc. its just weird.[/quote]

That’s how all servers should be. They should also all be packaged.

Read full topic

item.title: PvP in Varrock
item.dc:creator: @Pzezima2 Pzezima2
item.description:
@Pzezima2 wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:4, topic:426788”][quote author=Pzezima2 link=topic=529486.msg3864116#msg3864116 date=1324860485]

Find your “isinwilderness” method and convert it to Varrock coordinates. What source are you using?

Ive done all that, I’m using 317 PI but the way this server is coded is completely different to any other ones i’ve seen.
Very very different.
[/quote]

I don’t understand what you’re having trouble with. Check to make sure that your coordinates are in the right order. Also, make sure that you don’t need to add it anywhere else. Just look for your “wildarea” method more.[/quote]
Its just, with tuts for example they ask to go into player.java and search for inWild() etc but they’re all in a different file. And most stuff thats usually in the client.java is in its own class file etc. its just weird.

Read full topic

item.title: PvP in Varrock
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Pzezima2, post:3, topic:426788”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=529486.msg3864107#msg3864107 date=1324860064]
Find your “isinwilderness” method and convert it to Varrock coordinates. What source are you using?
[/quote]

Ive done all that, I’m using 317 PI but the way this server is coded is completely different to any other ones i’ve seen.
Very very different.[/quote]

I don’t understand what you’re having trouble with. Check to make sure that your coordinates are in the right order. Also, make sure that you don’t need to add it anywhere else. Just look for your “wildarea” method more.

Read full topic
